Praise ye the LORD: for <FI>it is<Fi> good to sing praises unto our God; for <FI>it is<Fi> pleasant; <FI>and<Fi> praise is comely.
The LORD doth build up Jerusalem: he gathereth together the outcasts of Israel.
He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.<RF>wounds: Heb. griefs<Rf>
He telleth the number of the stars; he calleth them all by <FI>their<Fi> names.
Great <FI>is<Fi> our Lord, and of great power: his understanding <FI>is<Fi> infinite.<RF>his…: Heb. of his understanding there is no number<Rf>
The LORD lifteth up the meek: he casteth the wicked down to the ground.
Sing unto the LORD with thanksgiving; sing praise upon the harp unto our God:
Who covereth the heaven with clouds, who prepareth rain for the earth, who maketh grass to grow upon the mountains.
He giveth to the beast his food, <FI>and<Fi> to the young ravens which cry.
He delighteth not in the strength of the horse: he taketh not pleasure in the legs of a man.
The LORD taketh pleasure in them that fear him, in those that hope in his mercy.<CM>
Praise the LORD, O Jerusalem; praise thy God, O Zion.
For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates; he hath blessed thy children within thee.
He maketh peace <FI>in<Fi> thy borders, <FI>and<Fi> filleth thee with the finest of the wheat.<RF>He…: Heb. Who maketh thy border peace<Rf><RF>finest…: Heb. fat of wheat<Rf>
He sendeth forth his commandment <FI>upon<Fi> earth: his word runneth very swiftly.
He giveth snow like wool: he scattereth the hoarfrost like ashes.
He casteth forth his ice like morsels: who can stand before his cold?
He sendeth out his word, and melteth them: he causeth his wind to blow, <FI>and<Fi> the waters flow.
He sheweth his word unto Jacob, his statutes and his judgments unto Israel.<RF>his word: Heb. his words<Rf>
He hath not dealt so with any nation: and <FI>as for his<Fi> judgments, they have not known them. Praise ye the LORD.<CM>
